colonel tom parker __knowledge__ parker's exceptionally high earnings have led some to question whether it came at the detriment of his client.

pet sounds __knowledge__ pet sounds is the eleventh studio album by american rock band the beach boys, released on may 16, 1966.

pet sounds __knowledge__ it initially met with a lukewarm critical and commercial response in the united states, peaking at number 10 in the "billboard" 200, a significantly lower placement than the band's preceding albums.

pet sounds __knowledge__ in the united kingdom, the album was hailed by its music press and was an immediate commercial success, peaking at number 2 in the uk top 40 albums chart and remaining among the top ten positions for six months.

jailhouse rock (fighting style) __knowledge__ jailhouse rock or jhr is a name used to describe a collection of different fighting styles that have been practiced and/or developed within us penal institutions.
jailhouse rock (fighting style) __knowledge__ the different regional “styles” of jhr vary but share a common emphasis on improvisation governed by a specific set of underlying principles.
jailhouse rock (fighting style) __knowledge__ some examples of the many styles of jhr are 52 hand blocks, comstock style, stato.
jailhouse rock (fighting style) __knowledge__ many of these styles of jhr are thought to have evolved regionally in different penal institutions.

jailhouse rock (fighting style) __knowledge__ jailhouse rock, the 52 hand blocks and their variants may be compared to savate, which was originally a semi-codified fighting method associated with an urban criminal subculture, which underwent a gradual process of codification before becoming established as a martial art accessible by the cultural mainstream.

hospice care in the united states __knowledge__ the concept of hospice as a place to treat the incurably ill has been evolving since the 11th century.
hospice care in the united states __knowledge__ hospice care was introduced to the united states in the 1970s in response to the work of cicely saunders in the united kingdom.
hospice care in the united states __knowledge__ this part of health care has expanded as people face a variety of issues with terminal illness.

hospice care in the united states __knowledge__ in the united states, it is distinguished by extensive use of volunteers and a greater emphasis on the patient's psychological needs in coming to terms with dying.

memphis mafia __knowledge__ the "memphis mafia" was the nickname given by rock 'n' roll icon elvis presley to a group of friends, associates, employees and cousins whose main functions were to accompany, protect, and serve elvis from the beginning of his career in 1954 until his death in 1977.
memphis mafia __knowledge__ several members filled practical roles in the singer's life.
memphis mafia __knowledge__ for instance, they were employed to work for him as bodyguards or on tour logistics and scheduling.
memphis mafia __knowledge__ in these cases elvis paid salaries, but most lived off fringe benefits such as gifts, cars, houses and bonuses.
memphis mafia __knowledge__ over the years, the number of members grew and changed, but for the most part there was a core group who spent a lot of time with the singer.
personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ elvis presley had many close relationships throughout his career.
personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ the strongest of all the personal relationships of elvis presley, by far, was that he had with his mother gladys, as described below.
personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ in a newspaper interview with "the memphis press scimitar", elvis himself was open about the close relationship to his mother.
personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ "she was the number-one girl in his life, and he was dedicating his career to her."
personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ throughout her life, "the son would call her by pet names," and they communicated by baby talk.

personal relationships of elvis presley __knowledge__ presley even shared his mother's bed "up until elvis was a young teen," simply because the family was so extremely poor that they couldn't afford the luxury of two beds.
walking in memphis __knowledge__ "walking in memphis" is a song composed and originally recorded by the american singer-songwriter marc cohn, for whom it remains his signature song.
walking in memphis __knowledge__ cohn said the song is "100 percent autobiographical".
walking in memphis __knowledge__ he described it as a song about "a jewish gospel-music-lover", and as "a pretty literal transcription of a visit i made ... in 1986.
walking in memphis __knowledge__ i went to graceland, i heard al green preach the gospel, i saw w. c. handy's statue.
walking in memphis __knowledge__ but the song is about more than just a place, it's about a kind of spiritual awakening, one of those trips where you're different when you leave."
walking in memphis __knowledge__ it reflects on cohn's experience as a jew who feels the gospel spirit of memphis.
